episodeTitle: A Vast Fleet Appears! Here Come the Whitebeard Pirates!
description: The world is shocked by the revelation that Ace is the son of Gol D. Roger. Flashbacks show Roger's final request to Garp and Portgas D. Rouge's sacrifice to protect her son. In the present, Whitebeard's massive fleet of 43 allied ships arrives at Marineford, followed by the Moby Dick emerging from underwater in a stunning tactical maneuver.

events.title: Ace's Parentage Revealed to the World
events.description: Fleet Admiral Sengoku publicly announces to the world that Portgas D. Ace is the biological son of Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King. This revelation shocks everyone present at Marineford and broadcasts around the world, changing the stakes of the execution.
events.significance: This is one of the most significant reveals in the series, explaining why the World Government is so determined to execute Ace. It connects the previous Pirate King to the current generation and raises the stakes of the Marineford War.

quotes.text: Ace's father is none other than the Pirate King, Gol D. Roger!
quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: Sengoku reveals Ace's true parentage to the world

events.title: Roger's Final Request to Garp
events.description: In a flashback, Roger visits Garp in his prison cell before his execution and asks his old rival to protect his unborn child. Roger explains that an infant shouldn't be labeled a criminal just for family ties, and Garp reluctantly agrees, trusting Roger as much as a friend despite their adversarial history.
events.significance: This flashback reveals the deep bond between Roger and Garp, transcending their roles as pirate and Marine. It shows Roger's humanity and explains why Garp took responsibility for Ace, setting up the emotional conflict Garp faces throughout Marineford.

quotes.text: I don't have much time left, but I'm going to have a child. Will you protect it for me?
quotes.speaker: Gol D. Roger
quotes.context: Roger asks Garp to protect his unborn child

quotes.text: A child is innocent! They bear no sins!
quotes.speaker: Gol D. Roger
quotes.context: Roger explains why his child deserves protection

events.title: Portgas D. Rouge's Twenty-Month Pregnancy
events.description: The flashback reveals that Ace's mother, Portgas D. Rouge, held Ace in her womb for twenty months through sheer willpower to deceive the World Government and protect her child from being discovered as Roger's son. The Marines had been searching and killing all pregnant women and newborns in the area.
events.significance: This reveals one of the most extraordinary sacrifices in the series, showing Rouge's incredible willpower and love for her child. It demonstrates the World Government's ruthlessness and the lengths they went to eliminate Roger's bloodline.

quotes.text: I will protect this child, no matter what it takes.
quotes.speaker: Portgas D. Rouge
quotes.context: Rouge's determination to protect her unborn child

events.title: Portgas D. Rouge's Death After Childbirth
events.description: After holding her pregnancy for twenty months, Rouge finally gives birth to Ace. She names him 'Gol D. Ace' as Roger had instructed (or 'Ann' if a girl), and dies from exhaustion with a smile on her face, happy that she protected her son.
events.significance: Rouge's death is a tragic sacrifice that parallels many themes in One Piece about inherited will and protecting the next generation. Her smile mirrors Roger's smile at his execution, showing the will of D. Her sacrifice ensures Ace's survival.

quotes.text: If it's a boy, his name will be Ace. If it's a girl, Ann.
quotes.speaker: Portgas D. Rouge
quotes.context: Rouge names her child according to Roger's wishes before dying

events.title: Garp Takes Baby Ace to Dadan
events.description: Garp takes baby Ace from Baterilla and brings him to Mt. Colubo on Dawn Island, entrusting him to Curly Dadan to raise. This is where Ace will eventually meet and grow up with Luffy.
events.significance: This explains how Ace and Luffy came to be raised together and why Garp chose Dawn Island as a safe haven for Roger's son. It sets up the brotherhood between Ace and Luffy that becomes central to the Marineford conflict.

quotes.text: Dadan, you're going to raise this child.
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Garp brings baby Ace to Dadan

events.title: Garp Visits Ace in Impel Down
events.description: In a flashback to a recent event, Garp visits Ace in his cell at Impel Down before the execution. Ace tells Garp that the only father he recognizes is Whitebeard, rejecting his blood connection to Roger.
events.significance: This shows Ace's emotional conflict about his heritage and his deep loyalty to Whitebeard. It also displays Garp's internal struggle between his duty as a Marine and his love for his adopted grandson.

quotes.text: My father is Whitebeard! I have no other father!
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace rejects Roger as his father and claims Whitebeard instead

events.title: Luffy and Prisoners Reach the Gates of Justice
events.description: Luffy and the escaped prisoners from Impel Down aboard their stolen Marine ship witness the Gates of Justice mysteriously opening for them near Marineford, allowing them passage toward the battle.
events.significance: This shows that someone is helping Luffy reach Marineford, though it's not revealed who at this point. The opening gates build tension as Luffy races toward the battlefield to save Ace.

quotes.text: The Gates of Justice are opening! But who could have opened them?
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Surprise at the gates mysteriously opening

events.title: Whitebeard's Allied Fleet Emerges from the Fog
events.description: Forty-three ships belonging to New World pirate captains allied with Whitebeard emerge from the fog surrounding Marineford. The Marines are shocked by the sudden appearance of such a massive fleet.
events.significance: This demonstrates Whitebeard's power and influence - he commands not just his own crew but 43 allied crews of powerful New World pirates. It shows the scale of the conflict and raises the stakes of the Marineford War.

events.title: New World Captains Introduction
events.description: Eight powerful New World pirate captains allied with Whitebeard are introduced: Doma (the Bohemian Knight), McGuy (the Thunder Lord), the Decalvan Brothers, Squard (the Great Whirlpool Spider), Elmy, Ramba, A O, and Delacuaji. Each is noted as an infamous pirate who has made a name in the New World.
events.significance: These captains represent the breadth of Whitebeard's influence and add to the overwhelming force assembled to rescue Ace. Several of these characters will have important roles in the coming battle.

quotes.text: All of them are captains who've made their names known throughout the New World!
quotes.speaker: Marine Officer

events.title: The Moby Dick Emerges from Underwater
events.description: In a stunning tactical maneuver, the Moby Dick and three other Whitebeard ships emerge from underwater in the center of Marineford Bay, having used coating to bypass the Marine defenses. The ships surface with all 14 division commanders aboard, catching the Marines completely off guard.
events.significance: This is one of the most iconic moments in the Marineford Arc, showcasing Whitebeard's tactical brilliance. By appearing in the center of the bay rather than from the expected direction, he completely outmaneuvers the Marine forces and demonstrates why he's feared as the World's Strongest Man.

events.title: Whitebeard's Arrival at Marineford
events.description: Edward Newgate (Whitebeard) steps to the front of the Moby Dick, removing his medical equipment and ready for battle. He greets Fleet Admiral Sengoku, marking the formal beginning of the confrontation. The world's strongest man has arrived to save his son.
events.significance: This is one of the most iconic entrances in anime history. Whitebeard's arrival represents the pinnacle of his legend - an old, sick man willing to challenge the entire World Government to save one of his 'sons.' It establishes the emotional and physical stakes of the war.

quotes.text: Sengoku... it's been a long time. My beloved son... is he safe?
quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Whitebeard's first words upon arriving at Marineford

events.title: The Baterilla Massacre
events.description: Flashback reveals that the World Government conducted a brutal search on Baterilla Island and surrounding areas, investigating and killing pregnant women and newborn children in an attempt to find and eliminate Roger's child.
events.significance: This shows the World Government's absolute ruthlessness and willingness to commit genocide to eliminate perceived threats. It contextualizes why Rouge's sacrifice was necessary and demonstrates the dark nature of the World Government's 'justice.'

themes.description: The episode explores how the sins (or virtues) of parents affect their children, with Roger's legacy creating danger for Ace, while also showing how Ace chooses his own family in Whitebeard.
themes.symbolism: Rouge's sacrifice and smile mirror Roger's will, showing how the spirit of freedom and love transcends death.

themes.description: Both Roger and Rouge make ultimate sacrifices for Ace - Roger entrusting him to Garp, Rouge giving her life to protect him. This theme of parental sacrifice echoes throughout One Piece.
themes.symbolism: The twenty-month pregnancy represents the extraordinary lengths a parent will go to protect their child.

themes.description: Ace's rejection of Roger and acceptance of Whitebeard as his true father shows that family is defined by bonds and love, not blood.
themes.symbolism: Whitebeard calling his crew 'sons' and Ace calling him 'Pops' represents the chosen family that means more than biological ties.

themes.description: The episode questions the World Government's 'justice' through their willingness to massacre innocents to eliminate Roger's bloodline, contrasted with Roger's argument that children are innocent.
themes.symbolism: The Baterilla massacre represents the dark side of absolute justice.

characterSpotlights.development: Rouge is revealed as an incredibly strong-willed woman who sacrificed everything to protect her son, demonstrating the same indomitable will as Roger.

Named her child according to Roger's wishes
Died with a smile after ensuring Ace's safety

Used coating to bypass Marine defenses
Emerged in the center of Marineford Bay

characterSpotlights.development: Garp's internal conflict is highlighted as we see both his promise to Roger and his recent visit to Ace in prison, showing his love for both his duty and his adopted grandson.

Took baby Ace to Dadan to raise
Visited Ace in Impel Down before execution

characterSpotlights.development: Through flashbacks, we learn about Ace's birth and the incredible sacrifices made for his survival. His rejection of Roger in favor of Whitebeard shows his emotional stance on family.

mangaDifferences.difference: Rouge's face is shown more clearly in the anime, whereas the manga kept her face partially obscured in some panels.
The anime depicts the Marines' brutality during the Baterilla search more graphically than the manga.
Reused animation from the 12th opening theme during certain scenes.
First full reveal of Akainu's eyes in the anime.

trivia.fact: This episode received a 10.4% TV rating in Japan, ranking 3rd for the week.
Episode 460 adapted pages 3-16 of Chapter 551, with the chapter being split across multiple episodes (455, 459, 460, and 461).
The twenty-month pregnancy is one of the most extreme displays of willpower in the series, showing Rouge's incredible determination.
This episode marks the first time Akainu's eyes are fully shown in the anime series.
Whitebeard's underwater arrival using coating is a callback to the technique introduced during the Sabaody Archipelago arc.
The episode aired during Season 14 (Season Piece 1 for Voyage 8).
